Nightshift says not one word, but takes a look around.  He was not about to=
 move too quickly and knew it would be trouble if he did.  Yet he transmits=
 via text to Polarclaw and Wolfgang.

" No go'n back now, door just shut be=
hind us.  Anyway, the area looks deserted.  Everything appears untouched, a=
nd no prints anywhere.  I ain't gonna buy the all clear line just yet, beca=
use this could be a trap.  If it looks too easy, don't buy into it.  Batsco=
ut, see if you can pick up any unknown signatures.  I ain't convinced that =
we're alone."

Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for thi=
ngs you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.

On=
 Nov 22, 2011, at 12:36 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:=


> > <OLD>
> >
> > As the door swung open, Nightshift scoots in like a cat=
 trying to get out of
> > the house. He motions Batscout with his tail as h=
e does so, darting in,
> > keeping his body low to the ground, padding on s=
ilent paws. Without a sound
> > he hides in the darkness of the shadows, an=
d crouches in a corner of the
> > room, lying motionless. He then texts Wol=
fgang.
> >
> > "Never mind, I'm in, door just opened, so I took the opportu=
nity when it
> > came available. From here on out, text messages only. No o=
ne knows I'm
> > here, except for you guys. Let's keep it that way."
> 
> <=
NEW>
> 
> As NIGHTSHIFT went through the door so did BATSCOUT, his movement=
s
> nearly soundless, only the small beating of his wings as he came
> thro=
ugh the door.
> 
> "Will do." came the text message from both POLAR CLAW an=
d WOLFGANG.
> 
> The inside of the next room was pretty large. It was well =
lit and
> dusty. Metal boxes and crates line the wall neatly stacked and to=
tally
> undisturbed. If anyone had been in here in a while there was no
> e=
vidence of their passage, even the dust on the floor was pristine,
> with n=
o footprints or tracks. At the other end of the room there was a
> door lea=
ding further into the base.
> 
> Behind NIGHTSHIFT and BATSCOUT the door th=
ey came in began to swing shut.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-F91ECA36-BF96-411A-9600-986DFE6294B5

<html><head></head><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Nightshift says not one w=
ord, but takes a look around.  He was not about to move too quickly an=
d knew it would be trouble if he did.  Yet he transmits via text to Po=
larclaw and Wolfgang.</div><div><br></div><div>" No go'n back now, door jus=
t shut behind us.  Anyway, the area looks deserted.  Everything a=
ppears untouched, and no prints anywhere.  I ain't gonna buy the all c=
lear line just yet, because this could be a trap.  If it looks too eas=
y, don't buy into it.  Batscout, see if you can pick up any unknown si=
gnatures.  I ain't convinced that we're alone."<br><br>Don't be enviou=
s of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already posses.  =
Nothing is worth more than family and friends.</div><div><br>On Nov 22, 201=

      <p>> <OLD><=
br>
><br>
> As the door swung open, Nightshift scoots in like a cat t=
rying to get out of<br>
> the house.  He motions Batscout with his tail =
as he does so, darting in,<br>
> keeping his body low to the ground, pad=
ding on silent paws.  Without a sound<br>
> he hides in the darkness of =
the shadows, and crouches in a corner of the<br>
> room, lying motionles=
s.  He then texts Wolfgang.<br>
><br>
> "Never mind, I'm in, door jus=
t opened, so I took the opportunity when it<br>
> came available.  From =
here on out, text messages only.  No one knows I'm<br>
> here, except fo=
r you guys.  Let's keep it that way."<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
As NIGH=
TSHIFT went through the door so did BATSCOUT, his movements<br>
nearly soun=
dless, only the small beating of his wings as he came<br>
through the door.=
<br>
<br>
"Will do." came the text message from both POLAR CLAW and WOLFGAN=
G.<br>
<br>
The inside of the next room was pretty large. It was well lit a=
nd<br>
dusty. Metal boxes and crates line the wall neatly stacked and total=
ly<br>
undisturbed. If anyone had been in here in a while there was no<br>
=
evidence of their passage, even the dust on the floor was pristine,<br>
wit=
h no footprints or tracks. At the other end of the room there was a<br>
doo=
r leading further into the base.<br>
<br>
Behind NIGHTSHIFT and BATSCOUT th=
e door they came in began to swing shut.<br>
<br>

<br>
- Preston<=
